subject: Management
title: Bridges' Transition Model
description: A 60-second lesson on Bridges' Transition Model.

hook.text: A restructure was announced Monday. By Friday, people were still grieving the old team, not embracing the new.

buildup.text: William Bridges: change is external (what happens). Transition is internal (how people process it).

discovery.text: Three phases: ending (letting go), neutral zone (uncertainty), new beginning (embrace).

twist.text: Leaders announce the new beginning. People are still in the ending phase. The gap causes resistance.

climax.text: Honor the ending. Support the neutral zone. Only then can people genuinely start the new beginning.

punchline.text: Change is instant. Transition is not. Give people the time.

quiz.question: What is the key insight of Bridges' transition model?
options: Change is external and instant, but internal transition takes time through three phases
Transitions happen at the same speed as the announced change
People should skip the grieving phase and immediately embrace the new
